result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Earl Appleton

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in court.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court for Robert Earl Appleton.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense filed motion and requested motion hearing/final pretrial and jury trial dates. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing/final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Defense to file Denny motion by December 7, 2022 and motion in limine by January 11, 2022. State to file motion response by January 4, 2023. Motion hearing/final pretrial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 02:00 pm. Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defendant appeared by zoom, currently at work. Case adjourned for tomorrow afternoon; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Letter from Attorney Fenton, Re. Status of Motion.  Received and Filed.  nk
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9-12-22

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton appeared by video.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Robert Earl Appleton.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Case is tracking along as a Status Conference date to co-side with pending felony matter. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Earl Appleton appeared by video means. Defense is requesting a reduction in Justice Point supervision level. State is objecting to any modification. Court denies request to modify supervision level. Court sets 09/02/2022 by 5:00 pm as the deadline to file any motions. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Earl Appleton appeared by video means with Attorney Fenton. Defense is waiting on more discovery and a potential global offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-9-22

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Greg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Braunreiter.  Court took Judical Notice of case 21CF3503. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Robert Earl Appleton in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Earl Appleton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
